verses.plain: My son, forget not my law; but let thine heart keep my commandments:

tokens.t: My son, forget not my law; but let thine heart keep my commandments:

verses.plain: For length of days, and long life, and peace, shall they add to thee.

tokens.t: For length of days, and long life, and peace, shall they add to thee.

verses.plain: Let not mercy and truth forsake thee: bind them about thy neck; write them upon the table of thine heart:

tokens.t: Let not mercy and truth forsake thee: bind them about thy neck; write them upon the table of thine heart:

verses.plain: So shalt thou find favour and good understanding in the sight of God and man.

tokens.t: So shalt thou find favour and good understanding in the sight of God and man.

verses.plain: ¶ Trust in the LORD with all thine heart; and lean not unto thine own understanding.

tokens.t: ¶ Trust in the
with all thine heart; and lean not unto thine own understanding.

verses.plain: In all thy ways acknowledge him, and he shall direct thy paths.

tokens.t: In all thy ways acknowledge him, and he shall direct thy paths.

verses.plain: ¶ Be not wise in thine own eyes: fear the LORD, and depart from evil.

tokens.t: ¶ Be not wise in thine own eyes: fear the
, and depart from evil.

verses.plain: It shall be health to thy navel, and marrow to thy bones.

tokens.t: It shall be health to thy navel, and marrow to thy bones.

verses.plain: Honour the LORD with thy substance, and with the firstfruits of all thine increase:

tokens.t: Honour the
with thy substance, and with the firstfruits of all thine increase:

verses.plain: So shall thy barns be filled with plenty, and thy presses shall burst out with new wine.

tokens.t: So shall thy barns be filled with plenty, and thy presses shall burst out with new wine.

verses.plain: ¶ My son, despise not the chastening of the LORD; neither be weary of his correction:

tokens.t: ¶ My son, despise not the chastening of the
; neither be weary of his correction:

verses.plain: For whom the LORD loveth he correcteth; even as a father the son in whom he delighteth.

tokens.t: For whom the
loveth he correcteth; even as a father the son
he delighteth.

verses.plain: ¶ Happy is the man that findeth wisdom, and the man that getteth understanding.

tokens.t: ¶ Happy
the man
findeth wisdom, and the man
getteth understanding.

verses.plain: For the merchandise of it is better than the merchandise of silver, and the gain thereof than fine gold.

tokens.t: For the merchandise of it
better than the merchandise of silver, and the gain thereof than fine gold.

verses.plain: She is more precious than rubies: and all the things thou canst desire are not to be compared unto her.

tokens.t: She
more precious than rubies: and all the things thou canst desire are not to be compared unto her.

verses.plain: Length of days is in her right hand; and in her left hand riches and honour.

tokens.t: Length of days
in her right hand;
in her left hand riches and honour.

verses.plain: Her ways are ways of pleasantness, and all her paths are peace.

tokens.t: Her ways
ways of pleasantness, and all her paths
peace.

verses.plain: She is a tree of life to them that lay hold upon her: and happy is every one that retaineth her.

tokens.t: She
a tree of life to them that lay hold upon her: and happy
that retaineth her.

verses.plain: The LORD by wisdom hath founded the earth; by understanding hath he established the heavens.

tokens.t: The
by wisdom hath founded the earth; by understanding hath he established the heavens.

verses.plain: By his knowledge the depths are broken up, and the clouds drop down the dew.

tokens.t: By his knowledge the depths are broken up, and the clouds drop down the dew.

verses.plain: ¶ My son, let not them depart from thine eyes: keep sound wisdom and discretion:

tokens.t: ¶ My son, let not them depart from thine eyes: keep sound wisdom and discretion:

verses.plain: So shall they be life unto thy soul, and grace to thy neck.

tokens.t: So shall they be life unto thy soul, and grace to thy neck.

verses.plain: Then shalt thou walk in thy way safely, and thy foot shall not stumble.

tokens.t: Then shalt thou walk in thy way safely, and thy foot shall not stumble.

verses.plain: When thou liest down, thou shalt not be afraid: yea, thou shalt lie down, and thy sleep shall be sweet.

tokens.t: When thou liest down, thou shalt not be afraid: yea, thou shalt lie down, and thy sleep shall be sweet.

verses.plain: Be not afraid of sudden fear, neither of the desolation of the wicked, when it cometh.

tokens.t: Be not afraid of sudden fear, neither of the desolation of the wicked, when it cometh.

verses.plain: For the LORD shall be thy confidence, and shall keep thy foot from being taken.

tokens.t: For the
shall be thy confidence, and shall keep thy foot from being taken.

verses.plain: ¶ Withhold not good from them to whom it is due, when it is in the power of thine hand to do it.

tokens.t: ¶ Withhold not good from them to whom it is due, when it is in the power of thine hand to do

verses.plain: Say not unto thy neighbour, Go, and come again, and to morrow I will give; when thou hast it by thee.

tokens.t: Say not unto thy neighbour, Go, and come again, and to morrow I will give; when thou hast it by thee.

verses.plain: Devise not evil against thy neighbour, seeing he dwelleth securely by thee.

tokens.t: Devise not evil against thy neighbour, seeing he dwelleth securely by thee.

verses.plain: ¶ Strive not with a man without cause, if he have done thee no harm.

tokens.t: ¶ Strive not with a man without cause, if he have done thee no harm.

verses.plain: ¶ Envy thou not the oppressor, and choose none of his ways.

tokens.t: ¶ Envy thou not the oppressor, and choose none of his ways.

verses.plain: For the froward is abomination to the LORD: but his secret is with the righteous.

tokens.t: For the froward
abomination to the
: but his secret
with the righteous.

verses.plain: ¶ The curse of the LORD is in the house of the wicked: but he blesseth the habitation of the just.

tokens.t: ¶ The curse of the
in the house of the wicked: but he blesseth the habitation of the just.

verses.plain: Surely he scorneth the scorners: but he giveth grace unto the lowly.

tokens.t: Surely he scorneth the scorners: but he giveth grace unto the lowly.

verses.plain: The wise shall inherit glory: but shame shall be the promotion of fools.

tokens.t: The wise shall inherit glory: but shame shall be the promotion of fools.

footnotes.text: that getteth…: Heb. that draweth out understanding
the oppressor: Heb. a man of violence
shall be…: Heb. exalteth the fools
